Package com.comodide.axiomatization

Class AxiomManager

java.lang.Object
com.comodide.axiomatization.AxiomManager
public class AxiomManager
extends java.lang.Object
The purpose of this class is to provide a single point of entry for the management, creation, and addition of Axioms based on certain actions. For example, add a new class to the ontology given a string, or rename a class, etc.
Author:
cogan

      public static AxiomManager getInstance​(org.protege.editor.owl.model.OWLModelManager modelManager)
      Gets the static instance of this class.

      If the instance field has not yet been initialized, then it is set to a new AxiomManager.

      Parameters:
      modelManager - is passed to the private constructor if this AxiomManager needs to be instantiated.
      Returns:
      This returns the static instance of this AxiomManager.

    • createOWLAxAxiom

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLAxiom createOWLAxAxiom​(OWLAxAxiomType axiomType, PropertyEdgeCell edgeCell)
      Constructs a new axiom by passing the given type and edge cell to this.owlaxAxiomFactory.createAxiomFromEdge.
      Parameters:
      axiomType - is passed to the createAxiomFromEdge method in the axiom factory class.
      edgeCell - is passed to the createAxiomFromEdge method in the axiom factory class.
      Returns:
      Returns the new axiom.

    • addOWLAxAxiom

      public void addOWLAxAxiom​(OWLAxAxiomType axiomType, PropertyEdgeCell edgeCell)
      Constructs a new axiom by passing the given type and edge cell to the createOWLAxAxiom method. An AddAxiom object is created and applied to the active ontology.
      Parameters:
      axiomType - is passed as an argument to the new axiom.
      edgeCell - is passed as an argument to the new axiom.

    • addOWLAxAxiomtoBFO

      public void addOWLAxAxiomtoBFO​(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity source, org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity target)
      Constructs a new axiom and initializes it to this.owlDataFacotry.getOWLSubClassOfAxiom. An AddAxiom object is created and applied to the active ontology.
      Parameters:
      source - is converted to an OWLClassExpression and is passed as the source argument to the getOWLSubClassOfAxiom method call.
      target - is converted to an OWLClassExpression and is passed as the target argument to the getOWLSubClassOfAxiom method call.

    • handleClassChange

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity handleClassChange​(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLClass currentClass, java.lang.String targetName)
      This method attempts to find a Class with the existing targetName If it does not find it, it will create a Class with target name in the active ontology.

      If the currentClass is null, then it will return the result from above.

      If the currentClass is not null and targetName exists, it will return targetName

      If the currentClass is not null and targetName did not exist, it will rename currentClass to targetName

      Parameters:
      currentClass - will be renamed to the target name if a class with the target name does not already exist.
      targetName - is the name of the target class.
      Returns:
      This returns a class with the target name.

    • handleClass

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity handleClass​(java.lang.String className)
      Determines if there is a class with the given sting className. If there is, the renameClass method is called and passed the given name.

      If there are no classes with the given name, then the addNewClass method is called and passed the given name.

      Parameters:
      className - is the name of a class that this method will rename or add.
      Returns:
      This returns a class with the given name as an OWLEntity.

    • findOrAddClass

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity findOrAddClass​(java.lang.String className)
      Determines if a class with the given class name exists. If there is not a class with the given name, then the addNewClass method is called and passed the given name.
      Parameters:
      className - is the name of the class this method will find or add.
      Returns:
      This returns a class with the given class name.

    • findEntity

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity findEntity​(java.lang.String entity) throws MultipleMatchesException
      This generates a set of entities by calling this.owlEntityFinder.getMatchingOWLEntities and passing the given string entity to the getMatchingOWLEntities method.

      If there is more than one element in the set, an exception is thrown.

      If there are no elements in the set, then null is returned.

      Parameters:
      entity - is the string representation of the entity this method attempts to find.
      Returns:
      This returns an entity matching the given string entity.
      Throws:
      MultipleMatchesException - is thrown if this.owlEntityFinder.getMatchingOWLEntities finds multiple entities that match the given string entity.

    • findClass

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLClass findClass​(java.lang.String clazz)
      This generates a set of classes by calling this.owlEntityFinder.getMatchingOWLClasses and passing the getMatchingOWLClasses method the given string clazz.

      If there is more than one element in the set, the MultipleMatchesException is thrown and log.warn is called. This method includes a catch block for the MultipleMatchesException. It generates an array of classes, and returns the first class in the array.

      If there are no elements in the set, then null is returned.

      Parameters:
      clazz - is the string representation of the class this method attempts to find.
      Returns:
      Returns a class matching the given string clazz.
      Throws:
      MultipleMatchesException - is thrown if this.owlEntityFinder.getMatchingOWLClasses finds multiple classes that match the given string clazz.

    • addNewClass

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLClass addNewClass​(java.lang.String str)
      This method starts by constructing a class IRI with the active namespace and the given string str. The class IRI is then passed to this.owlDataFactory.getOWLClass to create the new class. Before an AddAxiom object can be created, this method gets the declaration axiom from the new class. The declaration axiom is passed to a new AddAxiom, and the change is applied to the active ontology.

      This method is called when previousLabel.equals("")

      Parameters:
      str - is the name of the new class and is used to construct the class IRI.
      Returns:
      Returns the new class.

    • renameClass

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLClass renameClass​(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLClass oldClass, java.lang.String newName)
      Constructs a new class IRI using the active namespace and the given string newName. A list of OWLOntologyChange objects is generated using this.owlEntityRenamer.ChangeIRI. The given old class and the new IRI are passed to the changeIRI method. Finally, the list of changes is applied to the active ontology.

      This method should be called when !previousLabel.equals("")

      Parameters:
      oldClass - is passed to the changeIRI method.
      newName - is used to create the new IRI for the given old class.
      Returns:
      Returns an owlClass with the new IRI.

    • removeClass

      public void removeClass()
      This method should be called when newValue == null

    • addDatatype

      public java.util.List<org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLDatatype> addDatatype​(java.lang.String datatype)
      This method determines if the given string datatype is an existing OWLDatatype.
      Parameters:
      datatype - is the name of the target OWLDatatype.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of OWLDatatype objects that match the given string.

    • findDatatype

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLDatatype findDatatype​(java.lang.String datatype)
      Generates a set of OWLDatatype that match the given string datatype.

      If there is more than one element in the set, a MultipleMatchesException is thrown. This method includes a catch block for the MultipleMatchesException. It generates an array of OWLDatatype, and returns the first data type in the array.

      If there are no elements in the set, then null is returned.

      Parameters:
      datatype - is the name of the target OWLDatatype.
      Returns:
      Returns the OWLDatatype that matches the given string.
      Throws:
      MultipleMatchesException - is thrown when there are multiple data types that match the given string.

    • handleObjectProperty

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLObjectProperty handleObjectProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName, org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity domain, org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity range)
      This calls the findObjectProperty method to find the property with the given property name. If there is not a property with the given name, then a new one is added and a set of EdgeCreationAxiom is created to determine which axioms to create.

      If the set contains EdgeCreationAxiom.RDFS_DOMAIN_RANGE then the property, domain, and range are used to create OWLObjectPropertyDomainAxiom and OWLObjectPropertyRangeAxiom objects. The objects are then packaged into AddAxiom objects and applied to the active ontology.

      If the set contains EdgeCreationAxiom.SCOPED_DOMAIN or EdgeCreationAxiom.SCOPED_RANGE, then the property and range will be used to construct OWLObjectSomeValuesFrom and OWLObjectSomeValuesFrom objects respectively. The domain is used to generate the sub class axiom, which is passed to the AddAxiom object and applied to the active ontology.

      Parameters:
      propertyName - is the name of the target property.
      domain - is used to create a domain axiom or a sub class axiom depending on which axioms are in the set.
      range - is used to create a range axiom, an OWLObjectSomeValuesFrom object, or an OWLObjectAllValuesFrom object depending on which axioms are in the set.
      Returns:
      This returns the property with the given name.

    • findObjectProperty

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLObjectProperty findObjectProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)
      This calls the getMatchingOWLObjectProperties method from this owlEntityFinder to generate a set of properties that match the given property name.

      If there are no elements in the set, then null is returned.

      Parameters:
      propertyName - is the name of the property this method will search for.
      Returns:
      Returns the first property in the set whose short form matches the given property name.

    • addNewObjectProperty

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLObjectProperty addNewObjectProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)
      This creates an IRI for the new OWLObjectProperty from the active namespace and the given property name. The new IRI is passed to this.owlDataFactory.getOWLObjectProperty, which will initialize a new OWLObjectProperty. This method finishes by creating an AddAxiom object and applying it to the active ontology.
      Parameters:
      propteryName - is used to create an IRI for the new OWLObjectProperty.
      Returns:
      This returns the new object property.

    • handleDataProperty

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLDataProperty handleDataProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName, org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity domain, org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity range)
      This calls the findDataProperty method to find a data property with the given property name. If it does not find one, then addNewDataProperty is called to add a property with the given name and a set of EdgeCreationAxiom is created to determine which axioms to create.

      If the set contains EdgeCreationAxiom.RDFS_DOMAIN_RANGE, then the property, domain, and range are used to create OWLObjectPropertyDomainAxiom and OWLObjectPropertyRangeAxiom objects. The objects are then packaged into AddAxiom objects and applied to the active ontology.

      Parameters:
      propertyName - is the name of the property this method will either find or create.
      domain - is used create a domain axiom, which is passed as a parameter to the ArrayList of AddAxiom objects.
      range - is used create a range axiom, which is passed as a parameter to the ArrayList of AddAxiom objects.
      Returns:
      This returns the data property that has the given property name.

    • findDataProperty

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLDataProperty findDataProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)
      This calls the getMatchingOWLDataProperties method from this owlEntityFinder to generate a set of data properties that match the given property name.

      If there are no elements in the set, then null is returned.

      Parameters:
      propertyName - is the name of the property this method will search for.
      Returns:
      Returns the first data property in the set whose short form matches the given property name.

    • addNewDataProperty

      public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLDataProperty addNewDataProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)
      This creates an IRI for the new OWLDataProperty from the active namespace and the given property name. The new IRI is passed to this.owlDataFactory.getOWLDataProperty, which will initialize a new OWLDataProperty. This method finishes by creating an AddAxiom object and applying it to the active ontology.
      Parameters:
      propteryName - is used to create an IRI for the new OWLDataProperty.
      Returns:
      This returns the new data property.

    • parseSimpleAxiom

      public com.mxgraph.model.mxCell parseSimpleAxiom​(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLAxiom axiom)
      This casts the given axiom as a subClass axiom and then returns the value of the this.simpleAxiomParser.parseSimpleAxiom method call.
      Parameters:
      axiom - is the axiom to be parsed.
      Returns:
      Returns the result of parsing the axiom.

    • matchOWLAxAxiomType

      public boolean matchOWLAxAxiomType​(OWLAxAxiomType axiomType, PropertyEdgeCell edgeCell)
      Constructs a new axiom by passing the given type and edge cell to the createAxiomFromEdge method in this owlaxAxiomFactory. The active ontology is then searched for an axiom that matches the newly created axiom.
      Parameters:
      axiomType - is used to construct the axiom that will be compared to all of the axioms in the active ontology.
      edgeCell - is used to construct the axiom that will be compared to all of the axioms in the active ontology.
      Returns:
      Returns true if there is an axiom in the active ontology that matches the axiom created from the given type and edge cell.

    • matchSubClassAxiom

      public boolean matchSubClassAxiom​(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLClass source, org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLClass target)
      Creates a sub class axiom by passing the given source and target to this.owlDataFactory.getOWLSubClassOfAxiom. The active ontology is then searched for a sub class that matches the newly created sub class.
      Parameters:
      source - is used to create the sub class axiom that will be compared to all of the sub class axioms in the active ontology.
      target - is used to create the sub class axiom that will be compared to all of the sub class axioms in the active ontology.
      Returns:
      This returns true if there is a matching sub class.

    • matchSubPropertyAxiom

      public boolean matchSubPropertyAxiom​(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity source, org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLObjectProperty targePropertyExpression)
      Converts the source argument into an OWLObjectPropertyExpression, and constructs a subClass axiom using the source expression and the given target expression. The active ontology is then searched for a axioms with matching source expressions and sub class axioms.
      Parameters:
      source - is converted to a source property expression and used to search the active ontology for axioms with matching source expressions.
      targetPropertyExpression - is used to create a subClass axiom. If an axiom with a matching source expression is found, then it is checked for a matching sub class.
      Returns:
      Returns true if there is a sub property axiom in the active ontology with the same source expression and sub class axiom.
